Package ninja.jira.skeletonkey.app.controller

Class AccountController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ninja.jira.skeletonkey.app.controller.AccountController
  • @CrossOrigin
@Controller
@RequestMapping(path="/api/account")
public class AccountController
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the controller for class Account. Uses GET methods when retrieving data from db Uses POST methods otherwise

    • Method Detail

      • addNewAccount

        @PostMapping(path="/add")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addNewAccount​(@RequestParam
                                                                java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                                                @RequestParam
                                                                java.lang.String userID,
                                                                @RequestParam
                                                                java.lang.String accountType,
                                                                @RequestParam
                                                                double balance,
                                                                @RequestParam
                                                                double spendingLimit,
                                                                @RequestParam
                                                                double withdrawalLimit)
        This methods adds a new account to the account db
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - identifies the account
        userID - specifies which user this account belongs to
        accountType - type of account (savings/checking)
        balance - amount of funds in account
        spendingLimit - limit of spending per month
        withdrawalLimit - limit of withdrawal per month
        Returns:
        account object in json if successful, error message otherwise

      • getAccount

        @RequestMapping(path="/get")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAccount​(@RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String accountNumber)
        This method gets the account matching the accountNumber
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - identifies the account
        Returns:
        account object in json if successful, error message otherwise

      • getAllAccounts

        @RequestMapping(path="/all")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllAccounts()
        This method returns all accounts found in account db
        Returns:
        all accounts in json, empty json if no accounts found

      • getAllAccountByUser

        @RequestMapping(path="/user")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllAccountByUser​(@RequestParam
                                                                      java.lang.String userID)
        This method gets all accounts that belong to a user
        Parameters:
        userID - identifies the user
        Returns:
        all accounts in json, error message otherwise

      • updateAccount

        @PostMapping(path="/update")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateAccount​(@RequestParam
                                                                java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                                                java.lang.String userID,
                                                                java.lang.String accountType,
                                                                java.lang.Double balance,
                                                                java.lang.Double spendingLimit,
                                                                java.lang.Double withdrawalLimit)
        This method updates the account using param specified in request message
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - identifies the account
        userID - specifies which user the account is tied to
        accountType - type of account (savings/checking)
        balance - amount of funds in account
        spendingLimit - limit of spending per month
        withdrawalLimit - limit of withdrawal per month
        Returns:
        updated account object if successful, error message otherwise

      • deleteAccount

        @PostMapping(path="/delete")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAccount​(@RequestParam
                                                                java.lang.String accountNumber)
        This method deletes a account matching the accountNumber
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - identifies the account
        Returns:
        success message if successful, error otherwise

      • deleteAllAccounts

        @PostMapping(path="/deleteall")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllAccounts()
        This method deletes all accounts in db Does not check whether database is empty
        Returns:
        success message
